greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fibonacci-Pascal triangle; same as Pascal triangle, but beginning another Pascal triangle to the right of each row starting at row 2.
comment: the first five rows seen as numbers in decimal representation: row(n) = 110*row(n-1) + 1. - corrected by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 16 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
Richard L. Ollerton and Anthony G. Shannon, Some properties of generalized Pascal squares and triangles, Fib. Q., 36 (1998), 98-109. See Table 3.
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k), T(n,1)=1 and for n>1: T(n,2*n-2) = T(n,2*n-1)=1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 16 2013
mathematica: T[_, 1] = 1; T[n_, k_] /; k == 2*n-2 || k == 2*n-1 = 1; T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = T[n-1, k-1] + T[n-1, k]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, 2*n-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 30 2017, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
xref: Cf. A005408 (row length), A000225 (row sums), A000045 (central terms), A007318, A136431.
results.author: _Mark Dols_, Jul 12 2009, Jul 19 2009
